keywords.indexterm: Web Author Form controls and properties

body.p: supports a variety of built-in form controls that allow users to interact with documents with familiar user interface objects. The oxy_label function is also supported and can be used to change the style of generated text.

table.title: Supported Properties for Form Controls and Functions in

row.entry: This form control provides a button object that is used to invoke a specific action.
This form control provides a group of button objects that are used to invoke specific actions.
This form control offers a single checkbox or multiple checkboxes that can be used to enable or disable an option.
This form control provides a graphical object that is a drop-down menu of proposed values. It can also be used for a combination of a drop-down menu and an editable single-line text field.

entry.lines: columns editable tooltips values fontInherit (always true) labels color

entry.note: Some browsers interpret the HTML5 datePicker as a text-field.

row.entry: This form control offers a text field that allows the user to choose a date in a specified format. Some browsers include a calendar browsing mechanism along with the text field.

This form control is used for rendering HTML content. It is displayed as a graphical element shaped as a box. The shape of the box is determined by a specified width and the height is computed based upon the length of the text.
This form control offers a contextual menu that provides quick access to various actions. A pop-up form control can display single or multiple selections.

entry.lines: color tooltips values resultSeparator selectionMode labels columns rendererSort (has to be identical to editorSort)

row.entry: This form control provides a text box that can be used to enter multiple lines of text.

entry.lines: type columns (in average character width) rows fontInherit tooltip color

row.entry: This form control provides a text field box that is used for entering a single line of text.

entry.lines: type columns fontInherit (always true) tooltip color

row.entry: This form control provides a dialog box that allows you to select the location of local or remote resources. The inserted reference is made relative to the URL of the currently opened editor.
This function can be used as a value for the CSS content property to change the style of generated text.
